comments:
Running IES/WSWB 506 on Win 2K.

1.  Create a Java Launch Configuration wihtout specifying any Java Project
2.  Go to the Source Tab.
3.  Expand the Defaults
4.  Add any archive to the source tab.
5.  Click on Restore Defaults.
6.  Got the Null Pointer Exception.

Looking at the code, a new DefaultSourceContainer is created but the director 
is not initialized.

I got the followiing exception:

(But what Eclipse build is this? - we don't undestand WS versions)

Does the build id from Eclipse help?

Version: 3.0.0
Build id: 200405060200

yes - that helps. However, it would be even better <g> if you were using the 
latest build - I20040519.

Yes, I understand that I should use the latest build.  Unfortunately, our build 
process does not allow me to do that.  But I downloaded the latest build and 
try it with the Java Launch Configu again.  I got the same exception from the 
log.  Thanks!

RestoreDefaultAction needs to init the new DefaultSourceContainer that it 
created.

Created an attachment (id=10877)
Initialize the DefaultSourceContainer

Verified and Applied patch - thanks. Changes in RestoreDefaultAction and 
SourceLookupPanel. As well, I changed AbstractSourceLookupDirector to dispose 
old containers when new containers are added.
